title: Standardize cards, add borders, sun/moon toggle, and fix CompTIA A+ card

requirements.text: Add a consistent visible border/outline to all cards across the Dashboard, Certifications (CertificationSelector), and Study Materials pages. The border should be clearly visible in both light and dark themes and applied uniformly to every card component on every page.

quotes: Card outlines ‚Äî Add a visible border/outline to all cards on the dashboard so they read clearly as cards

acceptanceCriteria: All cards on the Dashboard page have a visible border in light and dark mode
All cards on the Certifications (CertificationSelector) page have a visible border in light and dark mode
All cards on the Study Materials page have a visible border in light and dark mode
Border style is consistent across all pages

requirements.text: Set a uniform fixed card size site-wide for all certification cards across Dashboard, Certifications, and Study Materials pages. Measure the largest card currently rendered (based on the Study Materials page visible in the screenshots) and apply that as the standard min-height and fixed width for all cards, so card dimensions do not change as users navigate between pages ‚Äî only the card content changes.

quotes: Uniform card sizes ‚Äî Measure the largest card across all pages and set that as the standard size for every card site-wide, so only the content changes as you navigate

acceptanceCriteria: All certification cards on Dashboard, Certifications, and Study Materials pages share the same fixed width and minimum height
Card dimensions do not shift or reflow when navigating between pages
Content within cards remains properly laid out and does not overflow the fixed card size

requirements.text: Standardize the CompTIA A+ card on the Study Materials page to match the layout of all other certification cards. Specifically: (1) Add a badge pill outline to the 'A+' label in the card header, matching the pill style used on Security+, Network+, Linux+, Cloud+, CySA+, PenTest+, and CASP+ cards. (2) Remove the extra subtitle text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)' from the card so it matches the clean header layout of other cards. Apply this same standardization to the A+ card wherever it appears across all pages (Dashboard, Certifications, Study Materials).

quotes: yes please standardize across the web site
CompTIA A+ card fix ‚Äî Add the badge pill outline/pill (matching the style of Security+, Network+, Linux+, etc.) and remove the extra subtitle text

acceptanceCriteria: The A+ label on all CompTIA A+ cards has a bordered pill/badge outline matching the style of other certification badge pills
The text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)' is removed from the CompTIA A+ card header across all pages
The CompTIA A+ card header layout visually matches the header layout of Security+, Network+, and other certification cards

constraints: Do not change any backend logic or data models
Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui

nonGoals: Changing certification data or exam content
